listitem.para: Reads a single character from the read stream and outputs that character as a word. If the read stream is a file, and the end of file is reached, READCHAR outputs the empty list (not the empty word). If the read stream is a terminal, echoing is turned off when READCHAR is invoked, and remains off until READLIST or READWORD are invoked or a &GENERICNAME; prompt is printed. Backslash, vertical bar, and tilde characters have no special meaning in this context.

listitem.programlisting: SHOW READCHAR Hello how are you? H
